activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd A Beckius

records.addlTxt:
10/21/22, $5000 CASH BOND IN THIS CASE SHALL BE TEMPORARILY CONVERTED TO A SIGNATURE BOND TO ALLOW FOR DEFENDANT'S TRANSPORT TO AND FROM, AND HIS STAY IN BETWEEN, AT THE BETTY FORD CLINIC. 

THE CONVERSION TO SIGNATURE BOND TAKES AFFECT AT THE TIME OF TRANSPORTATION OF THE DEFENDANT TO THE BETTY FORD CLINIC. HE SHALL BE TRANSPORTED THERE AND BACK BY A CLOSE FAMILY MEMBER (HOLLY BECKIUS, ARNIE BECKIUS, OR RUTH BECKIUS).

UPON RELEASE FROM BETTY FORD, DEFENDANT MUST CONTACT DISPATCH TO INFORM THEM THAT HE IS BEING RELEASED.

** AT THE TIME OF RELEASE FROM BETTY FORD, THIS SIGNATURE BOND CONVERTS BACK TO A $5,000 CASH BOND, AND THE DEFENDANT MUST PAY $5000 FOR HIS RELEASE FROM JAIL.**

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS REMAIN UNCHANGED: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:16 PM 22CF138/22CF64 - Defendant Todd A Beckius appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank appear by zoom for TB. Attorney Frank states that he has been appointed by SPD in 22CF64 but not in 22CF138; believes that he will be.

22CF138 - Attorney Frank has seen the criminal complaint but TB has received it. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about the prior bail hearing and notes that there was a request to go back into a treatment facility. Deputy Gerber has been provided by Holly a letter from Betty Ford. Court review the letter and speaks about betty ford waiting on insurance. Attorney Frank asks for a signature bond with a condition to be transfer to a clinic in MN and participate in the Betty Ford clinic. State objects and states that she is concerned with TB going to a different states. State isn't asking to increase the bond but does ask that the bond not be modified. Court speaks about the offenses and Betty Ford. 

Court amends the bail bond to a signature bond at the time of transportation of TB to a the  Betty Ford Clinic and be transported there and back by a close family member (wife or parents Ruth or Arnie Beckius) upon release the signature bond converts back to a cash bond and the defendant at that time may pay the $5000 cash bond for release. 

Condition of release: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

States asks that: Defendant take prescription drugs only with a valid prescription. 
Defendant is required to contact Dispatch upon release from the Betty Ford.

Court agrees to add the above conditions to the bond pertaining to prescription drugs and required to contact dispatch upon release.

Attorney Harper ask for a status within 3 weeks where TB can appear by zoom.

Attorney Frank waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

2:59 PM Defendant Todd Beckius appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in the courtroom for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank appears by video for the defendant. 

States asks for a $10,000 cash bond.
No drink provisions are requested.

Attorney Frank heard about treatment that TB was going to and that he has another meeting to be put back into the clinic for treatment again. Attorney Frank asks for a signature With the condition that upon release to be transported to the Betty Ford Clinic in Minnesota. 

Court speaks to Holly B. regarding relationship and living situation. 

Holly B. speaks about TB treatment, conversation with TB counselor and that they were looking to getting him into sober living center before this incident happened. Counselor recommends TB go back to the Betty Ford. HB has scheduled a phone meeting tomorrow with TB. 

Court asks who would be transporting TB? Holly states that it would be herself or a family member that would take him to Betty Ford.

Attorney Harper speaks that this would be an individual that should apply for treatment court and objects to a signature bond.

Attorney Frank speaks about TB record, references statue and his fourth offense is 20 years old. 

Holly B speaks about the mental component. 

Court orders $5,000 cash bond

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. Defendant shall not possess or consume any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

At the next hearing the court will be asking Holly about the status of treatment for TB at the Betty Ford Clinic.

Initial set for 10/21/22 at 1 PM

Attorney Frank asks if he may appear by zoom; court approves Attorney Frank to appear by zoom.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
